column2: General Mills, Inc. engages in the manufacture and marketing of branded consumer foods sold through retail stores. The company is headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota and currently employs 40,000 full-time employees. The firm is a supplier of branded and unbranded consumer food products to the North American foodservice and commercial baking industries. The company also provides pet food products through its subsidiary Blue Buffalo Pet Products Inc. The firm has four segments: U.S. Retail, International, Pet operating, and Convenience Stores and Foodservice. The firm offers a range of food products with a focus on categories, including ready-to-eat cereal; convenient meals, including meal kits, ethnic meals, pizza, soup, side dish mixes, frozen breakfast and frozen entrees; snacks, including grain, nutrition bars and frozen hot snacks; yogurt, and super-premium ice cream. The firm's other product categories include baking mixes and ingredients, and refrigerated and frozen dough. The company also provides food products for dogs and cats.
